agencyname: Bundesministerium für Wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
projecttitle: Promotion of the quality infrastructure to support the measurement of consumption and quality of drinking water and waste water II
project_descrip: Short: PROMOTION OF THE QUALITY INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE MEASUREMENT OF CONSUMPTION AND QUALITY OF DRINKING WATER AND WASTE WATER II Long: Objective - The reliability of quality analyses in the areas of drinking water and wastewater, measurements of drinking water consumption and water monitoring have been improved by strengthening the Quality Infrastructure institutions in Bolivia. Core problem - The technical, human and institutional capacities of the Quality Infrastructure institutions as a whole are still insufficient to be able to fulfil the essential responsibilities in the field of wastewater, water monitoring, the detection of pollutants in agricultural products through irrigation with treated wastewater, consumption measurement and an adequate quality of drinking water in suburban areas. Target group - A direct impact is achieved among the intermediaries, the institutions of the Quality Infrastructure (Metrology Institute, Accreditation Body, Standards Institute) and among the service users. Indirect effects are expected among consumers of drinking water and producers of wastewater as well as consumers of agricultural products. Political carrier - Ministry of Economy and Industry. Political carrier - Ministry of Productive Development and Plural Economy (Ministerio de Desarrollo Productivo y Economía Plural, MDPyEP). Methodological approach - The module is conceived as a multi-level approach. It focuses on the meso level, with an emphasis on strengthening the institutional competences of Quality Infrastructure organisations. The module organises expert trainings, advises institutions on their processes and assists them. The instruments used include PTB staff (2 long-term experts) as well as international, regional and national short-term experts. Material goods will be procured on a small scale. Main outputs - 1. The reliability of drinking water analysis results in suburban regions and of consumption measurement has improved. 2. The reliability of wastewater analysis results has improved. 3. The Bolivian metrology institute IBMETRO has expanded its competencies to provide services for water monitoring and the determination of pollutants in irrigation water as well as in food products of the primary market basket.

projecttitle: Know-how in water and wastewater Management, Construction of plant-based water purification plants at School sites in Burkina Faso, West Africa
project_descrip: Short: KNOW-HOW IN WATER AND WASTEWATER MANAGEMENT, CONSTRUCTION OF PLANT-BASED WATER PURIFICATION PLANTS AT SCHOOL SITES IN BURKINA FASO, WEST AFRICA Long: Between 2013-2017 the 'Wirtschaftsbetrieb Hagen (WBH)' was involved in planning and constructing a plant für treating and purifying used-water from private households just by using plants. A system had to be established first, to collect that water from households manually as no other drainage-system had currently been available. Costs were covered by the State of Northrhine-Westphalia (NRW) through Engagement Global gGmbH, co-financed by the WBH (only the proportion of the share of NRW is recorded here). Based on that knowledge and the existing plant for demonstration-purposes located in the Capital of Burkina Faso, the WBH was asked for assistance in building and maintaining such purification-plants on the premises of two schools in rural areas. Besides purifying used water, a major goal is to teach other people and the pupils how to make use of their used water in secondary systems (eg. watering public-green or other plants). Cultivation of useful plants - Management of cultivated areas / useful plants, - Use and application of drip irrigation, - Water cycle by means of treatment of gray and dirty water, - Functioning of sewage treatment plants, - Maintenance and maintenance of sewage treatment plants. The planned project includes the measures of joint construction and commissioning as well as the measure of knowledge exchange about economical consumption and the possibilities for using the water cycle.

projecttitle: Assessing Technical and Institutional Measures for the Sustainable Intensification of Water Use in Agriculture in the Zayandeh-Rud River, Iran
project_descrip: Short: ASSESSING TECHNICAL AND INSTITUTIONAL MEASURES FOR THE SUSTAINABLE INTENSIFICATION OF WATER USE IN AGRICULTURE IN THE ZAYANDEH-RUD RIVER, IRAN Long: Increasing competition for water resources and reduced supply from rainfall puts agricultural production and food security in danger, especially in water-scarce and semi-arid environments in Iran. This study aims to contribute to a better understanding of the shortcomings in the present institutional setting and governance structures of irrigated agriculture and develop tools and approaches for overcoming lock-in situations and barriers for the implementation of technical, organizational and institutional innovations. The study is expected to deliver insights and recommendations on how to increase the adoption of technical, organizational and institutional innovations for the sustainable intensification of water use in agriculture. The outcome will be a strategy pathway for the roll-out of measures and innovations. At the end, integration of results and findings will provide recommendations for framework development and application in the context of the ongoing IWRM-project.

project_descrip: Short: QUALITY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR EFFICIENT WATER MANAGEMENT Long: Programme objective: The population's living conditions and climatic resilience as well as the country's stability are improved by safe, discrimination-free access to (drinking) water and well-organized water and sewage management. Target Group: Jordan's population (approx. 10.5 million people as well as approx. 770.000 officially registered Syrian refugees). Political Partner: Ministry of Water and Irrigation (MWI). Methodological Approach: The module is geared to setting up new services at the QI institutions and to improving cooperation between QI and the water sector. Besides this, capacities of the institutions of the water sector for consumption metering will be extended. For this purpose, technical and process consultation will take place, vocational training and skill enhancement measures will be organized, and the dialogue between QI and the water sector will be encouraged. In addition, the transfer of international experiences on intermittent water supply will be supported. Important Outputs: 1. The Jordan National Metrology Institute (JNMI) offers new services in the field of fluid flow measurement. 2. The prerequisites for the cooperation between the Jordan Standards and Metrology Organization (JSMO) and the institutions of the water sector (MWI and WUs) have improved. 3. The MWI's and the WUs' capacities for improving the operating processes regarding water consumption metering have been enhanced.

agencyname: Federal State of Hesse
projecttitle: Qualification for energy and resource efficiency in Viet Nam
project_descrip: Short: QUALIFICATION FOR ENERGY AND RESOURCE EFFICIENCY IN VIET NAM Long: The advanced training courses serve vietnamese teachers to provide technical, methodological and operational skills for dealing with energy and resource efficient techniques and procedures. Two eight-week advanced training courses focusing on energy and resource efficiency in two new apprenticeships at the Vocational College for Machinery and Irrigation (VCMI), a partner vocational training institute in Viet Nam. As part of the TC project Vocational Training Reform Program in Viet Nam, the pilot introduction of the two training occupations Electronics Technician for Energy and Building Technology and Plant Mechanic for Sanitary, Heating and Air Conditioning at the VCMI is planned. Organisation of a study trip to Hessen and a dialogue event at the Vietnamese-German-University (VGU).
